title: Font for a fridge
content:
Hello all,

I'm looking for one of those retro scripts that is built out of a line and often used on cars/refridgerators.

If anyone has any suggestions, that'd be grand.

Like this;  
 [http://www.dafont.com/rocket-script.font](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013220658/http:/www.dafont.com/rocket-script.font "http://www.dafont.com/rocket-script.font")  
but good.

Thanks,

Graham
author: G T

comments.content:
Check out Leslie Carbaga's fonts.

[http://www.veer.com/search/results.aspx?keyword=Leslie%20carbaga&product...](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013220658/http:/www.veer.com/search/results.aspx?keyword=Leslie%20carbaga&producttype=TYP&pricemodel=RM%2CRF "http://www.veer.com/search/results.aspx?keyword=Leslie%20carbaga&producttype=TYP&pricemodel=RM%2CRF")

Michael

Three by Leslie Cabarga from Font Bureau:

[http://www.fontbureau.com/fonts/Streamline](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013220658/http:/www.fontbureau.com/fonts/Streamline "http://www.fontbureau.com/fonts/Streamline")  
 [http://www.fontbureau.com/fonts/Raceway](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013220658/http:/www.fontbureau.com/fonts/Raceway "http://www.fontbureau.com/fonts/Raceway")  
 [http://www.fontbureau.com/fonts/NeonStream](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013220658/http:/www.fontbureau.com/fonts/NeonStream "http://www.fontbureau.com/fonts/NeonStream")

And Stuart Sandler's has undoubtedly got a bunch over at [www.fontdiner.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013220658/http:/www.fontdiner.com/ "www.fontdiner.com")

Magneto [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/magneto/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013220658/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/magneto/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/magneto/")

Parkway [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/chank/parkway/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013220658/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/chank/parkway/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/chank/parkway/")

I have a font called Contempo that may be what you're looking for but I can only find it for the PC online

[http://www.buyfonts.com/value\_for\_money/contempo.htm](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013220658/http:/www.buyfonts.com/value_for_money/contempo.htm "http://www.buyfonts.com/value\_for\_money/contempo.htm")

Hi Graham,

Several of our Font Diner faces were inspired by these styles often referred to as Brightwork but we call 'em streamlined scripts . . .

Emblem Chief was actually inspired by an International Harvester refrigerator logo: [http://www.fontdiner.com/menu\_cfp.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013220658/http:/www.fontdiner.com/menu_cfp.html "http://www.fontdiner.com/menu\_cfp.html")

Continental Railway also shares the same connecting look: [http://www.fontdiner.com/menu\_brown.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013220658/http:/www.fontdiner.com/menu_brown.html "http://www.fontdiner.com/menu\_brown.html")

Permanent Waves is another in this look: [http://www.fontdiner.com/menu\_doggie.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013220658/http:/www.fontdiner.com/menu_doggie.html "http://www.fontdiner.com/menu\_doggie.html")

Best,  
Stuart
I have one called Americana Dreams...also all those others above.

Thanks everyone.

Had to decide quickly and found Raceway which suited perfectly.

Thanks for all your help.

Graham

Hi, above all links are really good. I appreciate to all.

Thanks, kunal

[Web Designer India](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013220658/http:/www.web-designer-india.com/)
